intro: Eupatorium radula, commonly known as the small eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in the summer months. Eupatorium radula is often found in wetlands and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil.
